edu.jhu.coe.PCFGLA
Class StateSetTreeList

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractCollection<Tree<StateSet>>
      edu.jhu.coe.PCFGLA.StateSetTreeList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Tree<StateSet>>, Collection<Tree<StateSet>>
public class StateSetTreeList
extends AbstractCollection<Tree<StateSet>>

Essentially equivalent to a List>, but each Tree is re-built every time from the corresponding Tree. This saves a lot of memory at the expense of some time. Most of the code is contained in the subclass StringTreeListIterator. Beware of the behavior of hasNext(), which deallocates the current tree (the last one returned by next()). This is PRESUMABLY when the current tree is no longer needed, but be careful.

Author:
Romain Thibaux
